description: Inherited from Middle English volvelle, from Medieval Latin volvellum, volvella, from volvō +‎ -ellum.

entries.meaning: (historical) A type of slide chart, a paper construction with rotating parts, formerly used for organization and calculation in astronomy and other subjects.
examples: Tholomye and Haly were cunnynd and wyſeIn the voluell, in the quadrant, and in the aſtroloby,To pronoſtycate truly the chaunce of fortunys dyſe.
